instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2779  - No backlight on LCD
threads.message:
CORRECT MOTHERBOARD NR:
820-2879
820-2879 - No backlight on LCD... Where should I start to measure?

1. Computer starts up. I have fan spin and chime. But no image! The screen is black, no apple logo when using light on the screen.
2. I have 12,6v on F9800 (for PPBUS_S0_LCDBKLT.
3. R9715 shows 180k, R9731 shows 200k.

threads.title: 820-2779  - No backlight on LCD
threads.message: There will never be backlight of there is no image. Voltage on C9010? Known good LCD assembly? Was this liquid?

threads.title: 820-2779  - No backlight on LCD
threads.message:
No Title

[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 38252"]There will never be backlight of there is no image. Voltage on C9010? Known good LCD assembly? Was this liquid?[/QUOTE]


U9000 Pin: 4 & 5 (Shows 0v).. Should be 3.4v. I think the IC is broken? On the otherside of the IC, i get correct volt.

threads.title: 820-2779  - No backlight on LCD
threads.message: I asked about C9010. If LCD is not recognized U9000 will never turn on either.

threads.title: 820-2779  - No backlight on LCD
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 38406"]I asked about C9010. If LCD is not recognized U9000 will never turn on either.[/QUOTE]

Yes, sorry Duke.. 

The C9010: I get 27.5V..

threads.title: 820-2779  - No backlight on LCD
threads.message: Also: J900 (pin 4) on the LVDS connector shows 27.5V..

threads.title: 820-2779  - No backlight on LCD
threads.message: Look at schematic and tell me what voltage should be there. Pretty impossible to have 27V there and if it is really there then it is VERY bad.

threads.title: 820-2779  - No backlight on LCD
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 38548"]Look at schematic and tell me what voltage should be there. Pretty impossible to have 27V there and if it is really there then it is VERY bad.[/QUOTE]

The voltage on C9010 shows 27v.. I have NO FAN spin now as well. Its gone. So where should I check first. Guess I need to trace everything back.. But where to start is FAN doesnt turn on? PPBUS_G3H..??

threads.title: 820-2779  - No backlight on LCD
threads.message: 27V is not possible! Especially not when the fan is not even spinning. How are you measuring this?
